body.name: Thermaltake Core P3 Pro E-ATX Tempered Glass Mid Tower Gaming Computer Chassis, Open Frame Panoramic Viewing, Glass Wall-Mount, Rotatable PCI-E Slots, CA-1G4-00M1WN-09
deliveryMessages: Or fastest delivery Thursday, February 15. Order within 3 hrs 8 mins
features: [LONG VGA CARD SUPPORTED] - Recessed radiator/AIO/storage mounting design gives more space for long GPU card mounting. Support VGA length up to 330mm (with Reservoir) or 450mm (without Reservoir)

[COOLING MOUNTING BRACKET] – On top of the original great ventilation open-frame Core P3 series, the newly added-on mounting bracket, especially designed for AIO/case fan, provides an extraordinary air flow and cooling solution to cool all latest core components.
[ROTATABLE PCI-E SLOT] – Mount GPU vertically or horizontally for your unique taste
[STRONG STEADY FEET] – the Core P6-like foot design provides a more stable display for all types of heavy built.
[3 WAY PLACEMENT LAYOUT] - Wall mount, vertical, and horizontal placement
body.description: Thermaltake Core P3 Pro is a successor of the famous iconic Thermaltake Core P3 gaming computer case series. The newly add-on accessories, including new cooling mounting bracket, recessed cooling/storage mounting motherboard tray, and Core P6-like integrated feet, gives this new generation to easily adopt for all types of latest components. •P/N: CA-1G4-00M1WN-09 •CASE TYPE: Mid Tower •DIMENSION (H X W X D): 535 x 268 x 500 mm (21.06 x 10.55 x 19.69 inch) •NET WEIGHT: 12.5 kg / 27.6 lbs. •SIDE PANEL: 4mm Tempered Glass x 1 •COLOR: Black •MATERIAL: SPCC •DRIVE BAYS: 2 x 3.5” or 3 x 2.5” 4 x 3.5” or 5 x 2.5” (With HDD bracket) •EXPANSION SLOTS: 8 •MOTHERBOARDS: 6.7” x 6.7” (Mini ITX), 9.6” x 9.6” (Micro ATX), 12” x 9.6” (ATX), 12” x 10.5” (E-ATX) •I/O PORT: USB 3.2 (Gen 2) Type-C x 1, USB 3.0 x 2, HD Audio x 1 •PSU: Standard PS2 PSU (optional) •FAN SUPPORT: Right (M/B Side): 3 x 120mm, 2 x 120mm, 1 x 120mm, 3 x 140mm, 2 x 140mm, 1 x 140mm •Bracket (front or top): 3 x 120mm, 2 x 120mm, 1 x 120mm, 3 x 140mm, 2 x 140mm, 1 x 140mm •RADIATOR SUPPORT: Right (M/B Side): 1 x 360mm, 1 x 240mm, 1 x 120mm, 1 x 420mm, 1 x 280mm, 1 x 140mm •Bracket (front or top): 1 x 360mm, 1 x 240mm, 1 x 120mm, 1 x 420mm, 1 x 280mm, 1 x 140mm •CLEARANCE: CPU cooler height limitation: 180mm VGA length limitation: 330mm(With reservoir) 450mm(Without reservoir), PSU length limitation: 200mm.

productInformation.name: Customer Reviews
productInformation.value: 4.5 4.5 out of 5 stars 64 ratings 4.5 out of 5 stars

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 31, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Amazing case with horrible instructions
reviews.reviewText: I want to start off by saying that if you are thinking about buying this case, JUST DO IT! It looks amazing and the thermals are fantastic. As far as noise, it is quieter than the Lancool 3 that I replaced by quite a large margin.Now to the not so great part: the instructions. I have never in my life seen instructions this horrible. There is no order to go in and just random areas that say hey bud, here is how you put together this part. I knew I was in trouble when on the first page it shows a completed build and tells me how to install the base. I highly recommend watching some YouTube build videos to get a better idea of how to do this but don't let this stop you from buying the case. Once you figure out the install, it really is incredible.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 17, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great case, an insane amount of room to work with
reviews.reviewText: I went for an open box case and it worked out great. I ended up wall mounting it with a $15 tv mount (VideoSecu Ultra Slim TV Wall Mount for Most 27"-47" LCD LED Plasma TV) and have had no issues at all.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 16, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Good test bench, but...
reviews.reviewText: Thermaltake Core P3 Pro was purchased for use as a test bench, replacing an ALAMENGDA AL02 bench that my system has outgrown. As a test bench, the Core P3 Pro provides adequate space and mounting points for all system components and the capability to route/hide system cables within the chassis base. With the included rubber feet attached to the chassis base/side, the Core P3 Pro can be placed flat on the work table for easy component access (see attached picture) or sit upright to save workspace. The included adjustable GPU support bracket is hefty and the best that I've encountered.Build quality is excellent and assembly is straight forward, although the included fasteners are all packaged together, making it tedious to identify which are needed for each application. The pictorial based assembly instructions were complete and easy to follow.An irritating problem with the Core P3 Pro is the poor quality chassis USB Type C port/cable. The pre-installed cable is a thin ribbon type and although advertised as USB 3.2 Gen2 capable, it cannot support USB3.2 Gen2 speed/power requirements With the cable connected to my Strix Z790-E motherboard USB-C front panel header, the OS warns of USB failure and then freezes whenever attempting to transfer large files with an external USB-C type NVMe enclosure. The Thermaltake cable is definitely the problem source, since with a Graugear USB 3.2 Type-C header cable connected to the motherboard header, large files transfer at USB3 Gen2.2 rated speed without causing system/OS failure. The Core P3 Pro is not recommended if front panel USB-C capability is important.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 13, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Open and Cool!
reviews.reviewText: Excellent case if you're looking for an open-air design. Very unique really no negatives about it. What you see in the pictures is what you get. The chassis is vesa mountable if you want to wall mount and a glass front but the rest is wide open air. Again if you're looking for an open-air case besides your typical bench case applications which really aren't for everyday use this is the way to go.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 7, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Buy this now!
reviews.reviewText: Arctic 420mm AIO was a perfect fitThis has been my favorite case to build in, high-quality materials, packaged very well! Just an absolute blast to build with. Order a 420mm aio while you are at it.TT also has some of the best customer service you can ask for.Cons:-I wish there were a plastic case for the screws-Manual was all over the place but didn't bother me because it was so fun doing it on my own.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 23, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars Extremely disappointed - $4,000 wasted.
reviews.reviewText: I knew going into this that the case did not have any instructions, I was fine with that and had watched YouTube videos to follow along. I legitimately do not know if my unit is just damaged and this is why absolutely nothing lined up? But legitimately nothing lined up, my case has no gpu bracket because it legitimately can't fit as it doesn't line up, it shorted my motherboard multiple times and had to buy larger standoffs to prevent it. My case has no gpu support so I have to lay it on the side since I have nothing golding my gpu in. It is such a shame as I have spent $4,000 on my pc parts recently and really wanted this case to work. Now I just have a box filled with high end pc parts. I could return this but honestly it's not worth the hassle at this point. I spent several days trying to fix things and make the case work in the way it is. Higher discourage anyone from buying this case until they updated the packaging to have instructions.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 29, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Would you believe cable management A+++!!
reviews.reviewText: Love this case, ease of getting into regularly!!! Looks quite nice with glass on. 420 Arctic cooler works best in front. A side radiator install can interfear with huge E-ATX boards, especially with side facing connectors. I use Phobya fan spacers for better/quieter air flow thru radiator, blowing air across mobo and gpu. Dead quiet (when gaming some air noise), and best cooling ever! Surprisingly sturdy, but I won't be moving it with glass on. I'm adding a 420 Phobya grill on front over radiator for decor and protection.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 14, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Nice big (heavy) case
reviews.reviewText: Thermaltake has so many great designs. I was going to do a P3 build but this pro was on sale. It’s got plenty of room for upgrading, fans, pumps and extra radiator mounting options.The mounting holes in the back come in handy for under-desk mounting as this case is in the heavy side.Good channels for cable management.Does not come with GPU riser cable, so heads up if you plan on mounting vertical GPUThe directions that come with it are not easy to read. Fortunately there are lent of online builds/videos to reference
The case is nice but it took me a while to decode the instruction!

Well built, way sturdier than the original P3.For is size it has an exceptional amount of space to hide and route cables.Fun tip, this case CAN fit an XL-ATX board (I'm using the Aorus TRX40 Extreme), and with a little modification of the bracket, I SHOULD be able to also use the vertical GPU mount with the board.

reviews.reviewTitle: Beautiful case, use youtube to help put it together without headache
reviews.reviewText: This case is amazing for anyone who wants to really show off all the components of their pc build, it looks amazing and has room for basically anything you’ll need in it (unless you’re the type of person who wants 15+ fans, in which case the P8 is probably going to be a better choice for you). The added mounting bracket for the front(or back/top) is a big plus if you wanted more customization than the previous P3 version. Overall this is a welcomed upgrade from the (still very nice) P3 with more space in a surprisingly smaller size which means this case is a definite buy for anyone who enjoys customization and aesthetics. The only downside is the instructions can be challenging to read as the steps don’t necessarily go in order but a quick youtube search will give you more than enough step by step instructions to make putting it together a breeze.

reviews.reviewTitle: Thermaltake P3 Pro - Pros and Cons
reviews.reviewText: Built a new beast in a h300l from coolermaster, was an overheating nightmare. Just rebuilt in this badboy and wow just wow my computer looks unbelievable. the instructions are not great and the build does require some prior knowledge of PC building, I wouldn't recommend this case for beginners, there is ZERO handholding, almost like playing Elden Ring for the first time. this is my fourth build and I came across tons of issues, but hey I am a bit of a dumb dumb. fans look amazing, rgb looks great. thermals dropped 30%. I couldn't be happier. Not sure what part the other reviewer was looking for, as he didn't specify, but keep in mind this does not come with a PCI extension for your GPU so if you wish to run it vertically it requires a $100+ dollar part, which sucks. because HYTEs cases come with them for the same price point. I bought this at 250 cdn and it seems it be already on sale, which isn't an amazing sign for support but right now for this style of case, it is worth it but just keep those cons in mind !
